Class MandelbrotOutput<T>

java.lang.Object
com.mandelbrot.MandelbrotOutput<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type used to represent coordinates in the complex plane (e.g., Double, BigDecimal).
public class MandelbrotOutput<T> extends Object
Encapsulates the result of evaluating a point for membership in the Mandelbrot set.

This class records the number of iterations performed, the final orbit coordinates in both generic and double precision formats, and whether the point is considered to be inside the Mandelbrot set. It also provides detailed information on how membership was determined, including checks for common features such as the main cardioid and bulbs.

All instances are immutable and intended to provide accurate, structured output for rendering, analysis, or debugging of Mandelbrot evaluations.

Version:
1.0, 2025-06-10
Author:
George Miller

    • MandelbrotOutput

      public MandelbrotOutput(int iterations, T x, T y, double xDouble, Double yDouble, boolean inSet, MandelbrotOutput.HowFound howFound)
      Create a new instance of MandelbrotOutput.
      Parameters:
      iterations - The number of iterations the algorithm went through before returning.
      x - The x-coordinate of where the orbit ended in the generic class type.
      y - The y-coordinate of where the orbit ended in the generic class type.
      xDouble - The x-coordinate of where the orbit ended in the double type.
      yDouble - The y-coordinate of where the orbit ended in the double type.
      inSet - Whether or not this point is on the set.
      howFound - How the point was determined to be in the set, if it was.
